=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
Here's a plain‐language breakdown of what’s going on in the game:

• Game Genre and Overall Feel
 – It’s a top‐down puzzle/action game with elements of exploration, combat, and item collection.
 – You maneuver an avatar that can shoot a short‐lived projectile (a “sword”) to fight off roaming enemies.

• Game Mechanics
 – You control an avatar that can fire a sword attack. The attack acts like a projectile that can kill enemies.
 – The game field is made up of walls, floors, keys, doors (the goal), and a mix of enemies. The walls block movement.
 – You start out “nokey” (without an important item) and must pick up a key (an orange key sprite). When your avatar comes into contact with it, you transform into “withkey,” showing that you’ve collected the key.
 – There’s a door (goal sprite) that you need to interact with. However, only when you have the key (are in your “withkey” state) will the door “activate” (the door and the avatar with key interact to remove the door and give you points).
 – The sword projectile can also be used to defeat enemies. Knocking out enemies with your sword gives extra points.
 – Colliding with an enemy with your avatar (without using the sword) causes a penalty (the enemy kills the avatar, resulting in a negative score or a loss).

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions
 – The overall goal is to “beat” the level by using the key to interact with (remove) the door. The door disappearing signals a win.
 – If your avatar is killed (for example, by touching an enemy instead of using the sword), you lose the level.
 – Additional points are earned by collecting the key and by defeating enemies with your sword.

• Overall Strategy
 1. Explore the level carefully while keeping an eye on enemy positions. Avoid getting too close to enemies if you’re not ready to engage them.
 2. First, focus on picking up the key. This will transform your avatar from “nokey” to “withkey” and is necessary to eventually open (or remove) the door.
 3. Use your sword attack to knock out wandering enemies from a distance. Timing your shots is key, since direct contact is dangerous.
 4. Once you have the key, navigate to the door (the goal sprite). Since the door only “accepts” you with the key, aim to interact with it successfully to trigger the win condition.
 5. Maintain awareness of the layout – the walls, obstacles and enemy spawn points (which seem to be indicated by numbers on the map) will influence your maneuvering.
 6. Being patient and planning each move will let you secure points from enemy defeats and ensure that you don’t run into unavoidable danger.

In short, balance cautious exploration (to grab the key and avoid enemy collisions) with swift, accurate sword attacks to clear threats. Once you get the key, head for the door to win the level!

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
